ques:
You want to create a persistent storage area managed by Docker that is not tied to a specific container.

Create a named volume called **`db_data`**.
explanation: **`docker volume create`** creates a managed volume that can be mounted into containers to persist data.

title: Bind Mounts ğŸ”—
ques:
You want to mount the current directory `$(pwd)` on your host to `/app` inside the container for live reloading during development.

Write the flag to add to `docker run`.
explanation: **` -v (or --mount)`** maps a host file or directory to a location inside the container. This is called a **bind mount**.

title: Data Persistence ğŸ
ques: If you delete a container that was using a **named volume**, does the data in the volume get deleted automatically?
explanation: Volumes are independent of container lifecycles. They persist until explicitly removed using `docker volume rm`.

title: Listing Volumes ğŸ“‹
ques:
You want to see all the volumes currently present on your Docker host.

Write the command.
explanation: **`docker volume ls`** lists all named volumes on the system.

title: Cleaning Up ğŸ§¹
ques:
You want to remove all volumes that are **not** currently used by any container.

Write the command.
explanation: **`docker volume prune`** deletes all unused volumes, freeing up disk space.
